definition: to display one's slight skill before an expert (idiom)
surname Ban
team/class/squad/work shift/ranking/CL:個|个[ge4]/classifier for groups

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
surname Men
lane/alley
to do/to manage/to handle/to play with/to fool with/to mess with/to fix/to toy with
hatchet

sentences.english: He is always tell the director how to run the business; that's like teach his grandmother to suck egg.
sentences.chinese: 他老是對總裁說該如何管理業務，就跟班門弄斧似的。

sentences.english: In terms of writing, I dare not show off in the presence of an expert like you.
sentences.chinese: 說到寫文章，我實在不敢在你面前班門弄斧。

sentences.english: This idiom excoriates those who show accomplishments in front experts.
sentences.chinese: “班門弄斧”這個成語，用來在行家面前顯示本領。

sentences.english: Your cooking is better than mine, and I certainly prefer not having to bother to cook at all.
sentences.chinese: 你的菜煮得比我好，我當然就不想班門弄斧了。

sentences.english: Facing the teacher. I can't teach fish to swim.
sentences.chinese: 在老師面前，我不能班門弄斧。

sentences.english: He is always telling the director how to run the business; that's like teaching his grandmother to suck eggs.
sentences.chinese: 他老是對總裁說該如何管理業務，就跟班門弄斧似的。

sentences.english: Speaking of writing article, I dare not show off in front of you.
sentences.chinese: 說到寫文章，我實在不敢在你面前班門弄斧。

definition: to exaggerate
scholars tend to disparage one another (idiom)
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
to make a fool of oneself
lit. view a text and interpret (idiom); to interpret word by word without understanding the meaning/a far-fetched interpretation
to make an effort to become strong (idiom); determined to do better/to pull one's socks up
product placement
sequel/continuation of a book
to obstruct/to impede
flippant and insincere (piece of writing or speech)/glib-tongued/oily
to send (sb) away/to change the subject/to open (an umbrella etc)
to persist in one's views
lit. small belly, chicken's gut (idiom); narrow-minded/petty
anecdote/apocryphal story
lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
to push oneself forward/to seek fame/to be in the limelight/same as 出鋒頭|出锋头[chu1 feng1 tou5]
